summary: The Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) oversees the safety of natural gas and hazardous liquid pipelines. States sometimes work with PHMSA to inspect and oversee these pipelines. We looked into federal and state responsibilities for interstate pipeline inspections, and found that PHMSA expanded its inspector workforce by 25% between 2012 and 2017. title: Interstate Pipeline Inspections: Additional Planning Could Help DOT Determine Appropriate Level of State Participation
